{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 32-year-old lady who comes five days after unprotected sexual intercourse. The goal is to prevent pregnancy. The most effective method would be the copper IUCD (Intra-Uterine Contraceptive Device). However, since this method requires insertion of the device, it may not be feasible for this case. Therefore, we should consider other options. Levonorgestrel 0.75 mg is a form of emergency contraception that can prevent pregnancy up to five days after unprotected intercourse. It's an effective option in this scenario. Two tablets of high dose OCP (Oral Contraceptive Pill) repeated after 24 hours are not recommended as they may not be effective at this stage and could cause side effects.
